repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Road Management
            and Safety Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Road Management and
            Safety Project for Bosnia- Herzegovina were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, the risk to development outcome
            was low or negligible, the Bank performance was
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned included: Training of the staff within
            the integrated Project Implementation Directorate benefited
            the entire organization and not only the implementation
            unit. It enabled organization wide familiarization with
            modern rules for procurement and disbursement to carry out
            project operations timely and efficiently. Institutional
            strengthening and capacity building needed time and hands on
            supervision even with well motivated staff. Many roads in
            Bosnia and Herzegovina (BiH) that now are main roads used to
            be regional roads, and the regional roads used to be local
            roads, and, consequently, the characteristics of the
            classified road network are inadequate. The inference is
            that maintenance alone is insufficient to support economic
            reorientation and growth and improve traffic safety; the
            road network structure needs to be reassessed and rebuilt
            with appropriate standards as the demand for more transport
            infrastructure is growing. The Traffic Police must be fully
            involved in traffic safety work. There are about as many
            accidents in the urban areas as on the inter-city network,
            together over 70 percent of the total. The elderly are the
            most vulnerable group, and the most common cause of
            collisions is speeding. Therefore, safety work needs full
            cooperation of the police and the road administrations, and
            needs to be expanded to cover the urban areas. Effective
            enforcement requires cooperation between the key entities,
            the establishment of a lead agency, and the preparation of a
            strategy to guide the comprehensive response involving all stakeholders.

Bosnia and Herzegovina - Road Management and

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia-Herzegovina - Road Management and
            Safety Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The project development objectives of
            the Road Management and Safety Project for
            Bosnia-Herzegovina is to improve traffic flow and reduce
            accident rates on the country's road network. There are
            two main components. The first component finances road
            maintenance, rehabilitation, and safety improvements for the
            main and regional road network, including about 280 km of
            priority road sections in the Federation of Bosnia and
            Herzegovina, and about 290 km of priority road sections in
            the Republic of Srpska. The second component finances the
            institutional strengthening of the two road directorates
            (FBHRD and RSRD), including setting up of road and bridge
            data banks, introducing the use of the Highway Development
            Model (HDM) for setting road maintenance priorities,
            supervision for civil works, the use of competitive bidding
            procedures, familiarization with modern road maintenance
            technologies, improved financial management systems,
            establishing environmental units in each of the Road
            Directorates and to support these units in implementing
            their Environmental Management Plans (EMPs), staff training,
            and audits of the project accounts. This component also
            includes a program of technical support for the
            Bosnia-Herzegovina Road Infrastructure Public Corporation
            (BRIC), including establishing improved and uniform road and
            bridge design, maintenance and construction standards,
            creation of a road safety database, and conducting safety
            awareness campaigns.

Bosnia-Herzegovina - Road Management and
            Safety Project

TF038634-BOSNIA:  ROAD MANAGEMENT & SAFETY,TF040932-BOSNIA: ROAD MANAGEMENT AND

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Road Management
            and Safety Project : environmental management plan

abstracts.cdata!:
This environmental management plan (EMP)
            looks at the environmental adversity resulting from the
            implementation of the Road Management and Safety Project,
            and, proposes the following mitigation measures. During
            construction, it is expected that air, water, and noise
            pollution will occur : existing asphalt plants, stone
            quarries, and borrow pits will be used to supply, and
            materials will be transported, which should be covered,
            and/or sprayed to prevent dust emissions. Construction
            activities will be limited to daylight working schedules to
            control noise disturbances. Traffic disruptions will be
            minimized by an appropriate traffic management plan, through
            alternative access routes, and installation of road safety
            signs. Potential water, and soil pollution from improper
            disposal of waste materials, and contamination, call for
            waste disposal at selected sites, including appropriate
            handling, and storage of oil spills, or lubricants.
            Destruction of crops, and vegetation will occur : a working
            zone control will be ensured, as will vegetative
            propagation. During operation, similar measures will ensure
            air, water, and noise pollution, with additional protective
            noise barriers, planting hedges along roadsides, and
            limiting traffic as possible. Compliance with environmental
            standards, and health, and safety requirements will be ensured.

Bosnia and Herzegovina - Road Management and
            Safety Project : environmental management plan
